content.description: Climb a couple of jugs up to a big left hand gaston...then crimp, gaston and tryhard your way through a pretty hard boulder problem (V4/5) to a sit down rest. Some 5.11 climbing brings you to the chains. Beware the tree. Strong boulder'ers might find this an easily doable 5.12...route climbers may find it hard for 12b.
content.protection: 7 bolts to mussys.This route was bolted solely for the purpose of allowing for the first ascent, and the first ascent information is posted here solely to document the history of the first ascent. climbs.name: That's just my OLD acting up again

content.description: 100 feet around the left corner from the main crag is this single route.  Climb steep jugs on comfy but questionable rock to some smaller holds on the vertical wall.

content.description: The left of the central 5.12's on yellow rock. Start with a high undercling and climb up to to a small crimp on the smooth section of rock to a big move out left to a side pull and then an even bigger move to a jug way up there. Continued 5.12 climbing leads to the mussys on the slab above.

climbs.name: The Priceless Value of Old Friends

content.description: Climb steep rock and be thankful to the gods for 35 foot 5.10 routes this fun. A bunch of jugs and one crimp!  A few laps on this is a good warmup for the 12s.

content.description:
Climb up to the roof and secure the undercling pocket and do a big reach to some hard to see holds just above the second bolt and then make dynamic moves to surmount the small roof. Continued 5.11 climbing leads to the anchors.  One star due to the very low quality rock in the first roof.  Otherwise, a fun line.  

 Beta: Save this one for last.  Consider stickcliping the second bolt. Right hand in the 4 finger undercling pocket.  Don’t grab anything else on the chossy underside of that first roof.  Left hand above the second bolt, semi dynamic move to a good right hand edge in the darker rock.

climbs.name: All Your Pump Are Belong to Us!

content.description: All Your Pump is the first line I saw when I "found" this cliff. It proved to be one of the best. Slightly more bouldery than Delivering the Smiles but pretty continuous overall.

content.description:
A nice collection of routes above the madness of the Mary Jane Falls trail. It is like a steeper and harder version of Yellow Pine with similar rock. White Pine is a great place to get a pump on some steep climbs.

Thank you to those who contributed to developing this cliff.
